alert.note: Alert for Fannin; Murray; Walker; Whitfield (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 19 at 5:30PM EDT until August 19 at 11:30PM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: The National Weather Service in Peachtree City has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Northwestern Fannin County in north central Georgia... Murray County in northwestern Georgia... East Central Walker County in northwestern Georgia... Whitfield County in northwestern Georgia... * Until 1130 PM EDT. * At 530 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Dalton, Chatsworth, Varnell, Eton, Dawnville, Sumac, Crandall, Beaverdale, North Georgia Speedway, Fort Mountain State Park, Ramhurst, Gregory, Cisco, Conasauga Lake, Tennga, Rocky Face, Mill Creek and Cohutta Wilderness. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
